revised_title: Seasonal Reproductive Activity in Male Grey Squirrels
tldr: The study examines the reproductive organs of male grey squirrels and finds that they do not have a seasonal cycle like some other mammals. The reproductive activity in male grey squirrels varies, with some remaining sexually immature throughout the winter and starting to breed in the spring. The research also shows that there is no constant relationship between testes weight and body weight, suggesting individual fluctuations in reproductive activity.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Reproductive Biology
